Bullish structural narratives (AI momentum, institutional capital concentration in mega-cap tech, monetary policy tailwinds) are countered by tactical bearish signals (mid-cap weakness, earnings disappointments, sentiment-technicals disconnect). The divergence between mega-cap strength and broad participation remains the critical tell.

(3) **Geopolitical & Regulatory Uncertainty** â€“ Taiwan/U.S.-China tensions and financial sector headwinds represent binary tail risks; defensive positioning emerging tactically despite bullish structural case.

key_themes: Mega-Cap Tech Concentration vs. Broad Market Divergence
Monetary Policy Tailwinds & Rate Cut Expectations
risk_factors: Mid-cap weakness (IWM underperformance) signals early warning of participation breakdown despite mega-cap rally
Earnings & guidance cuts in enterprise software and fintech creating valuation compression pressure
Taiwan/U.S.-China escalation and geopolitical tail risks triggering rotation into defensive sectors
Year-end low-volume trading and early-January tax-loss harvesting potentially extending pullback momentum
Sentiment-technicals disconnect: strong bullish positioning contradicted by crypto weakness and mid-cap deteriorationâ€”contrarian capitulation risk or deteriorating fundamentals
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY testing $700 call wall (1.4% resistance, active hedging). Support at $670 (2.9% away, active hedging). QQQ squeezed between $625-$630 resistance (both ACTIVE, <1% range). Watch for breakout above $700 SPY or breakdown below $670 for directional confirmation. Near-term consolidation expected.

Lower support at $640 put wall (7.3% away, dormantâ€”acts as circuit breaker if weakness extends). QQQ: $630-$640 resistance zone critical; $625 near-term pivot.
